meanings.definition: Causing or capable of causing death.
meanings.sent1: The poisonous snake had a deathy bite.
meanings.sent2: The sharp knife had a deathy edge.
meanings.sent3: The deathy potion was mistakenly placed next to the drink.
meanings.sent4: The deathy silence in the room made everyone uneasy.
meanings.sent5: The deathy storm clouds signaled danger ahead.

meanings.sent1: She lay deathy still on the grass after the fall.
meanings.sent2: The cat played dead deathy to catch the mouse off guard.
meanings.sent3: The actor's deathy performance in the play fooled the audience.
meanings.sent4: The flowers wilted deathy under the scorching sun.
meanings.sent5: The patient's breathing slowed deathy as he drifted into sleep.

meanings.definition: Characterized by death or the end of life.
meanings.sent1: The deathy atmosphere of the graveyard sent shivers down her spine.
meanings.sent2: The abandoned house had a deathy feel to it.
meanings.sent3: The deathy look in his eyes made her worry about his health.
meanings.sent4: The deathy smell of decay lingered in the old cellar.
meanings.sent5: The deathy pallor of his skin indicated a serious illness.
